### Exercise 4
There are 6 observations in the dn_lq_ak data frame. The variables are: .x[address, city, state, zip, longitude, latitude] and .y[address, city, zip, longitude, latitude]


### Exercise 5

```{r calculating_distance}
library(pracma)
haversine <- haversine(longitude.x, latitude.x, longitude.y, latitude.y, round = 3 )
  long1 = longitude.x * pi / 180
  lat1 = latitude.x * pi / 180
  long2 = longitude.y * pi / 180
  lat2 = latitude.y * pi / 180
  
  R = 6371
  
  a = sin((lat2 - lat1)/2)^2 + cos(lat1) * cos(lat2) * sin((long2 - long1)/2)^2
  d = R * 2 *asin(sqrt(a))
  
  return( round(d,round) )
 
```
